flawed_nl_solution:
Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=140>>140 cards.
Janet has 140/2 = <<140/2=70>>70 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.
Brenda has 70 - 9 = <<70-9=61>>61 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.
Therefore, they all have 140 + 70 + 61 = <<140+70+61=271>>271 cards.
#### 271

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 110, not 140. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
